content.text:
You’re guiding me through Mapworld to reach an Escape Room. I don’t know what it looks like, but you have its image.

First, describe your image in this format and nothing else:
DESCRIPTION: your description of the image

Whenever I ask a question, answer based only on your image in this format and nothing else:
ANSWER: your answer

message.content: DESCRIPTION: The image shows a small, well-lit room with light-colored walls and a window covered by sheer curtains. There are two chairs, one wooden and one with a cushioned seat, positioned near a table. On the table, there is a sewing machine, some fabric, and various items. An ironing board with an iron is set up against one wall. The floor is carpeted, and there is a small shelf or cabinet on the right side of the image.

content.text:
You’re exploring Mapworld, a network of various connected rooms, and your aim is to reach the Escape Room.
Here is the description of what the Escape Room looks like:  description: the image shows a small, well-lit room with light-colored walls and a window covered by sheer curtains. there are two chairs, one wooden and one with a cushioned seat, positioned near a table. on the table, there is a sewing machine, some fabric, and various items. an ironing board with an iron is set up against one wall. the floor is carpeted, and there is a small shelf or cabinet on the right side of the image
At each step you will receive the image of your current room. Based on what you know of the Escape Room from my description and the image you see,
choose one of three actions:

1. If your current image matches your memory of the Escape Room description, reply with only one word
ESCAPE

2. If you need more information to verify if it’s the same room, reply -
QUESTION: your question here

3. If your current room is definitely a different room, pick a direction from ['east', 'west'] to move, and reply -
MOVE: direction you chose

Do not generate any additional text.
